intro: Manettia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican manettia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
